Module 1.title: What is Cybersecurity?
Module 1.definition: Cybersecurity is the practice of protecting digital systems, networks, and data from cyber threats.

components.human_security: Training, awareness, and policies to prevent human-related risks.
components.physical_security: Protecting hardware, infrastructure, and physical access.

confidentiality.definition: Ensuring data access is restricted to authorized users.
confidentiality.importance: Confidentiality is crucial for sensitive data like government intelligence, medical records, and proprietary software.

integrity.definition: Ensuring data accuracy and preventing unauthorized modifications.
integrity.importance: Integrity is essential for financial transactions, audit logs, and business reports.

availability.definition: Ensuring systems and data are accessible when needed.
availability.importance: Availability is crucial for online retailers, banking services, and cloud applications.

controls.definition: Controls are safeguards or countermeasures to avoid, detect, counteract, or minimize security risks to digital and physical assets.

Module 1.key_takeaway: The art of war teaches us to rely not on the likelihood of the enemy’s not coming, but on our own readiness to receive him. – Sun Tzu
learning_objectives: Describe the three components of cybersecurity.
Identify the objectives of the CIA triad.
List examples of security controls for each CIA objective.
next_steps: Continue to Module 2: Common Cybersecurity Threats.
Research recent cybersecurity breaches and analyze their impact.
Explore cybersecurity frameworks such as NIST, ISO 27001, and CIS Controls.

Module 2.title: Key Elements of Cybersecurity
Module 2.introduction: Cybersecurity relies on multiple approaches to secure information assets effectively.

key_elements.education: Building awareness through training to reduce risky behaviors and increase security compliance.
key_elements.process: Ensuring security is integrated into organizational workflows through clear, consistent, and accessible procedures.
key_elements.technology: Utilizing encryption, network defenses, and anti-malware to protect assets while balancing usability.

technology_examples.name: Automated patch management
technology_examples.business_benefit: All software is up to date
technology_examples.undesirable_user_response: User does not power down devices

technology_examples.name: High complexity mandatory passwords
technology_examples.business_benefit: Harder for attackers to guess passwords

technology_examples.name: Encrypted emails
technology_examples.business_benefit: Prevents attackers from reading messages in transit

learning_objectives: Describe the key elements of cybersecurity: education, process, and technology.
Classify tasks by using the key elements of cybersecurity.
